issue.title: $style not set when using vue-class-component decorator

issue.title: How can I add hot reload with ES6 class declaration?

repository.name: vue-class-component
repository.description: ES / TypeScript decorator for class-style Vue components.

issue.title: Problem using CSS Modules

repository.name: vue-class-component
repository.description: ES / TypeScript decorator for class-style Vue components.

issue.body:
Using vue-class-component, I can not reference CSS Module css class name using `$style.className` in the template.

See reproduction:
https://github.com/chanon/ts-vue-hmr/blob/master/src/components/Hello.vue#L13

It creates a runtime error in the browser:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/357737/23093711/4accacea-f61d-11e6-9508-c556a04c9a10.png)

I tried to create property / data declaration of $style but I could not get it to work.

issue.title: hot reload?

repository.name: vue-class-component
repository.description: ES / TypeScript decorator for class-style Vue components.

issue.body:
Are there any plans to support hot-reloading of templates like for example [vueify] does?

[vueify]: https://github.com/vuejs/vueify/blob/master/lib/compiler.js#L157

issue.title: fix: keep the overrides prototype information of component
issue.body:
add the component prototype override scenario and remove the version condition.
@eddyerburgh Actually I don't know why we need add a version condition here: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-test-utils/pull/709/commits/cacfda8acb2dfed54295b82fbd93e84205cec9d3 , any special reason?
